Each error code in the API is a four-digit number, for example, 1234, where the first number (1 in the example) represents the high-level error category, the second number (2 in the example) represents the low-level error category, and the last two numbers (34 in the example) represents the specific error.

completedTimestamp.title: DateTime
completedTimestamp.description: The API data type DateTime is a JSON String in a lexical format that is restricted by a regular expression for interoperability reasons. The format is according to [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html), expressed in a combined date, time and time zone format. A more readable version of the format is yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSS[-HH:MM]. Examples are "2016-05-24T08:38:08.699-04:00", "2016-05-24T08:38:08.699Z" (where Z indicates Zulu time zone, same as UTC).

transferState.title: TransferState
transferState.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- RECEIVED - Next ledger has received the transfer.
- RESERVED - Next ledger has reserved the transfer.
- COMMITTED - Next ledger has successfully performed the transfer.
- ABORTED - Next ledger has aborted the transfer due to a rejection or failure to perform the transfer.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The API data type Amount is a JSON String in a canonical format that is restricted by a regular expression for interoperability reasons. This pattern does not allow any trailing zeroes at all, but allows an amount without a minor currency unit. It also only allows four digits in the minor currency unit; a negative value is not allowed. Using more than 18 digits in the major currency unit is not allowed.

allOf.title: CurrencyConverter
allOf.description: Below are the allowed values for the enumeration CurrencyConverter. - PAYER - Currency conversion should be performed by the payer. - PAYEE - Currency conversion should be performed by the payee.

An optional field which will allow the payer DFSP to specify which DFSP it wants to undertake currency conversion. This is useful incase of if the sender wants the recipient to receive a specified amount of the target currency, but the payer DFSP does not want to undertake the currency conversion. In this case, the amount of the transfer would be expressed in the target currency and the amountType would be set to RECEIVE.

allOf.title: FxRate
allOf.description: The FxRate object contains information about a currency conversion in the transfer. It can be used by parties to the transfer to exchange information with each other about the exchange rate for the transfer, to ensure that the best rate can be agreed on.

partyIdType.title: PartyIdType
partyIdType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- MSISDN - An MSISDN (Mobile Station International Subscriber Directory Number, that is, the phone number) is used as reference to a participant. The MSISDN identifier should be in international format according to the [ITU-T E.164 standard](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). Optionally, the MSISDN may be prefixed by a single plus sign, indicating the international prefix.
- EMAIL - An email is used as reference to a participant. The format of the email should be according to the informational [RFC 3696](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3696).
- PERSONAL_ID - A personal identifier is used as reference to a participant. Examples of personal identification are passport number, birth certificate number, and national registration number. The identifier number is added in the PartyIdentifier element. The personal identifier type is added in the PartySubIdOrType element.
- BUSINESS - A specific Business (for example, an organization or a company) is used as reference to a participant. The BUSINESS identifier can be in any format. To make a transaction connected to a specific username or bill number in a Business, the PartySubIdOrType element should be used.
- DEVICE - A specific device (for example, a POS or ATM) ID connected to a specific business or organization is used as reference to a Party. For referencing a specific device under a specific business or organization, use the PartySubIdOrType element.
- ACCOUNT_ID - A bank account number or FSP account ID should be used as reference to a participant. The ACCOUNT_ID identifier can be in any format, as formats can greatly differ depending on country and FSP.
- IBAN - A bank account number or FSP account ID is used as reference to a participant. The IBAN identifier can consist of up to 34 alphanumeric characters and should be entered without whitespace.
- ALIAS An alias is used as reference to a participant. The alias should be created in the FSP as an alternative reference to an account owner. Another example of an alias is a username in the FSP system. The ALIAS identifier can be in any format. It is also possible to use the PartySubIdOrType element for identifying an account under an Alias defined by the PartyIdentifier.

amountType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration AmountType.
- SEND - Amount the Payer would like to send, that is, the amount that should be withdrawn from the Payer account including any fees.
- RECEIVE - Amount the Payer would like the Payee to receive, that is, the amount that should be sent to the receiver exclusive of any fees.

transactionType.title: TransactionType
transactionType.description: Data model for the complex type TransactionType.

scenario.title: TransactionScenario
scenario.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- DEPOSIT - Used for performing a Cash-In (deposit) transaction. In a normal scenario, electronic funds are transferred from a Business account to a Consumer account, and physical cash is given from the Consumer to the Business User.
- WITHDRAWAL - Used for performing a Cash-Out (withdrawal) transaction. In a normal scenario, electronic funds are transferred from a Consumers account to a Business account, and physical cash is given from the Business User to the Consumer.
- TRANSFER - Used for performing a P2P (Peer to Peer, or Consumer to Consumer) transaction.
- PAYMENT - Usually used for performing a transaction from a Consumer to a Merchant or Organization, but could also be for a B2B (Business to Business) payment. The transaction could be online for a purchase in an Internet store, in a physical store where both the Consumer and Business User are present, a bill payment, a donation, and so on.
- REFUND - Used for performing a refund of transaction.

subScenario.title: TransactionSubScenario
subScenario.description: Possible sub-scenario, defined locally within the scheme (UndefinedEnum Type).

initiator.title: TransactionInitiator
initiator.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- PAYER - Sender of funds is initiating the transaction. The account to send from is either owned by the Payer or is connected to the Payer in some way.
- PAYEE - Recipient of the funds is initiating the transaction by sending a transaction request. The Payer must approve the transaction, either automatically by a pre-generated OTP or by pre-approval of the Payee, or by manually approving in his or her own Device.

initiatorType.title: TransactionInitiatorType
initiatorType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- CONSUMER - Consumer is the initiator of the transaction.
- AGENT - Agent is the initiator of the transaction.
- BUSINESS - Business is the initiator of the transaction.
- DEVICE - Device is the initiator of the transaction.

allOf.title: CurrencyConverter
allOf.description: Below are the allowed values for the enumeration CurrencyConverter. - PAYER - Currency conversion should be performed by the payer. - PAYEE - Currency conversion should be performed by the payee.

An optional field which will allow the payer DFSP to specify which DFSP it wants to undertake currency conversion. This is useful incase of if the sender wants the recipient to receive a specified amount of the target currency, but the payer DFSP does not want to undertake the currency conversion. In this case, the amount of the transfer would be expressed in the target currency and the amountType would be set to RECEIVE.

allOf.description: The FxRate object contains information about a currency conversion in the transfer. It can be used by parties to the transfer to exchange information with each other about the exchange rate for the transfer, to ensure that the best rate can be agreed on.

- BUSINESS - A specific Business (for example, an organization or a company) is used as reference to a participant. The BUSINESS identifier can be in any format. To make a transaction connected to a specific username or bill number in a Business, the PartySubIdOrType element should be used.
- DEVICE - A specific device (for example, a POS or ATM) ID connected to a specific business or organization is used as reference to a Party. For referencing a specific device under a specific business or organization, use the PartySubIdOrType element.
- ACCOUNT_ID - A bank account number or FSP account ID should be used as reference to a participant. The ACCOUNT_ID identifier can be in any format, as formats can greatly differ depending on country and FSP.
- IBAN - A bank account number or FSP account ID is used as reference to a participant. The IBAN identifier can consist of up to 34 alphanumeric characters and should be entered without whitespace.
- ALIAS An alias is used as reference to a participant. The alias should be created in the FSP as an alternative reference to an account owner. Another example of an alias is a username in the FSP system. The ALIAS identifier can be in any format. It is also possible to use the PartySubIdOrType element for identifying an account under an Alias defined by the PartyIdentifier.

items.description: The currency codes defined in [ISO 4217](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html) as three-letter alphabetic codes are used as the standard naming representation for currencies.

amountType.title: AmountType
amountType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration AmountType.
- SEND - Amount the Payer would like to send, that is, the amount that should be withdrawn from the Payer account including any fees.
- RECEIVE - Amount the Payer would like the Payee to receive, that is, the amount that should be sent to the receiver exclusive of any fees.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The API data type Amount is a JSON String in a canonical format that is restricted by a regular expression for interoperability reasons. This pattern does not allow any trailing zeroes at all, but allows an amount without a minor currency unit. It also only allows four digits in the minor currency unit; a negative value is not allowed. Using more than 18 digits in the major currency unit is not allowed.

transactionType.title: TransactionType
transactionType.description: Data model for the complex type TransactionType.

scenario.title: TransactionScenario
scenario.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- DEPOSIT - Used for performing a Cash-In (deposit) transaction. In a normal scenario, electronic funds are transferred from a Business account to a Consumer account, and physical cash is given from the Consumer to the Business User.
- WITHDRAWAL - Used for performing a Cash-Out (withdrawal) transaction. In a normal scenario, electronic funds are transferred from a Consumers account to a Business account, and physical cash is given from the Business User to the Consumer.
- TRANSFER - Used for performing a P2P (Peer to Peer, or Consumer to Consumer) transaction.
- PAYMENT - Usually used for performing a transaction from a Consumer to a Merchant or Organization, but could also be for a B2B (Business to Business) payment. The transaction could be online for a purchase in an Internet store, in a physical store where both the Consumer and Business User are present, a bill payment, a donation, and so on.
- REFUND - Used for performing a refund of transaction.

subScenario.title: TransactionSubScenario
subScenario.description: Possible sub-scenario, defined locally within the scheme (UndefinedEnum Type).

initiator.title: TransactionInitiator
initiator.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- PAYER - Sender of funds is initiating the transaction. The account to send from is either owned by the Payer or is connected to the Payer in some way.
- PAYEE - Recipient of the funds is initiating the transaction by sending a transaction request. The Payer must approve the transaction, either automatically by a pre-generated OTP or by pre-approval of the Payee, or by manually approving in his or her own Device.

initiatorType.title: TransactionInitiatorType
initiatorType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- CONSUMER - Consumer is the initiator of the transaction.
- AGENT - Agent is the initiator of the transaction.
- BUSINESS - Business is the initiator of the transaction.
- DEVICE - Device is the initiator of the transaction.

allOf.title: CurrencyConverter
allOf.description: Below are the allowed values for the enumeration CurrencyConverter. - PAYER - Currency conversion should be performed by the payer. - PAYEE - Currency conversion should be performed by the payee.

An optional field which will allow the payer DFSP to specify which DFSP it wants to undertake currency conversion. This is useful incase of if the sender wants the recipient to receive a specified amount of the target currency, but the payer DFSP does not want to undertake the currency conversion. In this case, the amount of the transfer would be expressed in the target currency and the amountType would be set to RECEIVE.

partyIdInfo.description: Data model for the complex type PartyIdInfo. An ExtensionList element has been added to this reqeust in version v1.1

partyIdType.title: PartyIdType
partyIdType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- MSISDN - An MSISDN (Mobile Station International Subscriber Directory Number, that is, the phone number) is used as reference to a participant. The MSISDN identifier should be in international format according to the [ITU-T E.164 standard](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). Optionally, the MSISDN may be prefixed by a single plus sign, indicating the international prefix.
- EMAIL - An email is used as reference to a participant. The format of the email should be according to the informational [RFC 3696](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3696).
- PERSONAL_ID - A personal identifier is used as reference to a participant. Examples of personal identification are passport number, birth certificate number, and national registration number. The identifier number is added in the PartyIdentifier element. The personal identifier type is added in the PartySubIdOrType element.
- BUSINESS - A specific Business (for example, an organization or a company) is used as reference to a participant. The BUSINESS identifier can be in any format. To make a transaction connected to a specific username or bill number in a Business, the PartySubIdOrType element should be used.
- DEVICE - A specific device (for example, a POS or ATM) ID connected to a specific business or organization is used as reference to a Party. For referencing a specific device under a specific business or organization, use the PartySubIdOrType element.
- ACCOUNT_ID - A bank account number or FSP account ID should be used as reference to a participant. The ACCOUNT_ID identifier can be in any format, as formats can greatly differ depending on country and FSP.
- IBAN - A bank account number or FSP account ID is used as reference to a participant. The IBAN identifier can consist of up to 34 alphanumeric characters and should be entered without whitespace.
- ALIAS An alias is used as reference to a participant. The alias should be created in the FSP as an alternative reference to an account owner. Another example of an alias is a username in the FSP system. The ALIAS identifier can be in any format. It is also possible to use the PartySubIdOrType element for identifying an account under an Alias defined by the PartyIdentifier.

allOf.title: CurrencyConverter
allOf.description: Below are the allowed values for the enumeration CurrencyConverter. - PAYER - Currency conversion should be performed by the payer. - PAYEE - Currency conversion should be performed by the payee.

An optional field which will allow the payer DFSP to specify which DFSP it wants to undertake currency conversion. This is useful incase of if the sender wants the recipient to receive a specified amount of the target currency, but the payer DFSP does not want to undertake the currency conversion. In this case, the amount of the transfer would be expressed in the target currency and the amountType would be set to RECEIVE.

allOf.title: FxRate
allOf.description: The FxRate object contains information about a currency conversion in the transfer. It can be used by parties to the transfer to exchange information with each other about the exchange rate for the transfer, to ensure that the best rate can be agreed on.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The API data type Amount is a JSON String in a canonical format that is restricted by a regular expression for interoperability reasons. This pattern does not allow any trailing zeroes at all, but allows an amount without a minor currency unit. It also only allows four digits in the minor currency unit; a negative value is not allowed. Using more than 18 digits in the major currency unit is not allowed.

partyIdInfo.title: PartyIdInfo
partyIdInfo.description: Data model for the complex type PartyIdInfo. An ExtensionList element has been added to this reqeust in version v1.1

partyIdType.title: PartyIdType
partyIdType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- MSISDN - An MSISDN (Mobile Station International Subscriber Directory Number, that is, the phone number) is used as reference to a participant. The MSISDN identifier should be in international format according to the [ITU-T E.164 standard](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). Optionally, the MSISDN may be prefixed by a single plus sign, indicating the international prefix.
- EMAIL - An email is used as reference to a participant. The format of the email should be according to the informational [RFC 3696](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3696).
- PERSONAL_ID - A personal identifier is used as reference to a participant. Examples of personal identification are passport number, birth certificate number, and national registration number. The identifier number is added in the PartyIdentifier element. The personal identifier type is added in the PartySubIdOrType element.
- BUSINESS - A specific Business (for example, an organization or a company) is used as reference to a participant. The BUSINESS identifier can be in any format. To make a transaction connected to a specific username or bill number in a Business, the PartySubIdOrType element should be used.
- DEVICE - A specific device (for example, a POS or ATM) ID connected to a specific business or organization is used as reference to a Party. For referencing a specific device under a specific business or organization, use the PartySubIdOrType element.
- ACCOUNT_ID - A bank account number or FSP account ID should be used as reference to a participant. The ACCOUNT_ID identifier can be in any format, as formats can greatly differ depending on country and FSP.
- IBAN - A bank account number or FSP account ID is used as reference to a participant. The IBAN identifier can consist of up to 34 alphanumeric characters and should be entered without whitespace.
- ALIAS An alias is used as reference to a participant. The alias should be created in the FSP as an alternative reference to an account owner. Another example of an alias is a username in the FSP system. The ALIAS identifier can be in any format. It is also possible to use the PartySubIdOrType element for identifying an account under an Alias defined by the PartyIdentifier.

statusCode.description:

Otherwise, a suitable generic FSPIOP will be used with the errorResponse in the FSPIOP error message.

Currency.title: Currency
Currency.description: The currency codes defined in [ISO 4217](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html) as three-letter alphabetic codes are used as the standard naming representation for currencies.

Amount.title: Amount
Amount.description: The API data type Amount is a JSON String in a canonical format that is restricted by a regular expression for interoperability reasons. This pattern does not allow any trailing zeroes at all, but allows an amount without a minor currency unit. It also only allows four digits in the minor currency unit; a negative value is not allowed. Using more than 18 digits in the major currency unit is not allowed.

DateTime.title: DateTime
DateTime.description: The API data type DateTime is a JSON String in a lexical format that is restricted by a regular expression for interoperability reasons. The format is according to [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html), expressed in a combined date, time and time zone format. A more readable version of the format is yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSS[-HH:MM]. Examples are "2016-05-24T08:38:08.699-04:00", "2016-05-24T08:38:08.699Z" (where Z indicates Zulu time zone, same as UTC).

onlyValidateParty.description: Set to true if only party validation is required.  This means the quotes and transfers will not run. This is useful for only party resolution.

autoAcceptQuote.description: Set to true if the quote response is accepted without confirmation from the payer. The fees applied by the payee will be acceptable to the payer abiding by the limits set by optional 'perTransferFeeLimits' array.

skipPartyLookup.description: Set to true if supplying an FSPID for the payee party and no party resolution is needed. This may be useful if a previous party resolution has been performed.

synchronous.description: Set to true if the bulkTransfer requests need be handled synchronous. Otherwise the requests will be handled asynchronously, meaning there will  be callbacks whenever the processing is done

The format is according to [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html), expressed in a combined date, time and time zone format. A more readable version of the format is yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSS[-HH:MM]. Examples are "2016-05-24T08:38:08.699-04:00", "2016-05-24T08:38:08.699Z" (where Z indicates Zulu time zone, same as UTC).

PartyIdType.title: PartyIdType
PartyIdType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- MSISDN - An MSISDN (Mobile Station International Subscriber Directory Number, that is, the phone number) is used as reference to a participant. The MSISDN identifier should be in international format according to the [ITU-T E.164 standard](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). Optionally, the MSISDN may be prefixed by a single plus sign, indicating the international prefix.
- EMAIL - An email is used as reference to a participant. The format of the email should be according to the informational [RFC 3696](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3696).
- PERSONAL_ID - A personal identifier is used as reference to a participant. Examples of personal identification are passport number, birth certificate number, and national registration number. The identifier number is added in the PartyIdentifier element. The personal identifier type is added in the PartySubIdOrType element.
- BUSINESS - A specific Business (for example, an organization or a company) is used as reference to a participant. The BUSINESS identifier can be in any format. To make a transaction connected to a specific username or bill number in a Business, the PartySubIdOrType element should be used.
- DEVICE - A specific device (for example, a POS or ATM) ID connected to a specific business or organization is used as reference to a Party. For referencing a specific device under a specific business or organization, use the PartySubIdOrType element.
- ACCOUNT_ID - A bank account number or FSP account ID should be used as reference to a participant. The ACCOUNT_ID identifier can be in any format, as formats can greatly differ depending on country and FSP.
- IBAN - A bank account number or FSP account ID is used as reference to a participant. The IBAN identifier can consist of up to 34 alphanumeric characters and should be entered without whitespace.
- ALIAS An alias is used as reference to a participant. The alias should be created in the FSP as an alternative reference to an account owner. Another example of an alias is a username in the FSP system. The ALIAS identifier can be in any format. It is also possible to use the PartySubIdOrType element for identifying an account under an Alias defined by the PartyIdentifier.

Below are the allowed values for the enumeration AmountType.
- SEND - Amount the Payer would like to send, that is, the amount that should be withdrawn from the Payer account including any fees.
- RECEIVE - Amount the Payer would like the Payee to receive, that is, the amount that should be sent to the receiver exclusive of any fees.

partyIdInfo.title: PartyIdInfo
partyIdInfo.description: Data model for the complex type PartyIdInfo. An ExtensionList element has been added to this reqeust in version v1.1

partyIdType.title: PartyIdType
partyIdType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- MSISDN - An MSISDN (Mobile Station International Subscriber Directory Number, that is, the phone number) is used as reference to a participant. The MSISDN identifier should be in international format according to the [ITU-T E.164 standard](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). Optionally, the MSISDN may be prefixed by a single plus sign, indicating the international prefix.
- EMAIL - An email is used as reference to a participant. The format of the email should be according to the informational [RFC 3696](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3696).
- PERSONAL_ID - A personal identifier is used as reference to a participant. Examples of personal identification are passport number, birth certificate number, and national registration number. The identifier number is added in the PartyIdentifier element. The personal identifier type is added in the PartySubIdOrType element.
- BUSINESS - A specific Business (for example, an organization or a company) is used as reference to a participant. The BUSINESS identifier can be in any format. To make a transaction connected to a specific username or bill number in a Business, the PartySubIdOrType element should be used.
- DEVICE - A specific device (for example, a POS or ATM) ID connected to a specific business or organization is used as reference to a Party. For referencing a specific device under a specific business or organization, use the PartySubIdOrType element.
- ACCOUNT_ID - A bank account number or FSP account ID should be used as reference to a participant. The ACCOUNT_ID identifier can be in any format, as formats can greatly differ depending on country and FSP.
- IBAN - A bank account number or FSP account ID is used as reference to a participant. The IBAN identifier can consist of up to 34 alphanumeric characters and should be entered without whitespace.
- ALIAS An alias is used as reference to a participant. The alias should be created in the FSP as an alternative reference to an account owner. Another example of an alias is a username in the FSP system. The ALIAS identifier can be in any format. It is also possible to use the PartySubIdOrType element for identifying an account under an Alias defined by the PartyIdentifier.

supportedCurrencies.description: Currencies in which the party can receive funds.

items.title: Currency
items.description: The currency codes defined in [ISO 4217](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html) as three-letter alphabetic codes are used as the standard naming representation for currencies.

amountType.title: AmountType
amountType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration AmountType.
- SEND - Amount the Payer would like to send, that is, the amount that should be withdrawn from the Payer account including any fees.
- RECEIVE - Amount the Payer would like the Payee to receive, that is, the amount that should be sent to the receiver exclusive of any fees.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency codes defined in [ISO 4217](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html) as three-letter alphabetic codes are used as the standard naming representation for currencies.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The API data type Amount is a JSON String in a canonical format that is restricted by a regular expression for interoperability reasons. This pattern does not allow any trailing zeroes at all, but allows an amount without a minor currency unit. It also only allows four digits in the minor currency unit; a negative value is not allowed. Using more than 18 digits in the major currency unit is not allowed.

onlyValidateParty.description: Set to true if only party validation is required.  This means the quotes and transfers will not run. This is useful for only party resolution.

autoAcceptQuote.description: Set to true if the quote response is accepted without confirmation from the payer. The fees applied by the payee will be acceptable to the payer abiding by the limits set by optional 'perTransferFeeLimits' array.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency codes defined in [ISO 4217](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html) as three-letter alphabetic codes are used as the standard naming representation for currencies.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The API data type Amount is a JSON String in a canonical format that is restricted by a regular expression for interoperability reasons. This pattern does not allow any trailing zeroes at all, but allows an amount without a minor currency unit. It also only allows four digits in the minor currency unit; a negative value is not allowed. Using more than 18 digits in the major currency unit is not allowed.

skipPartyLookup.description: Set to true if supplying an FSPID for the payee party and no party resolution is needed. This may be useful if a previous party resolution has been performed.

synchronous.description: Set to true if the bulkTransfer requests need be handled synchronous. Otherwise the requests will be handled asynchronously, meaning there will  be callbacks whenever the processing is done

bulkExpiration.title: DateTime
bulkExpiration.description: The API data type DateTime is a JSON String in a lexical format that is restricted by a regular expression for interoperability reasons. The format is according to [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html), expressed in a combined date, time and time zone format. A more readable version of the format is yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSS[-HH:MM]. Examples are "2016-05-24T08:38:08.699-04:00", "2016-05-24T08:38:08.699Z" (where Z indicates Zulu time zone, same as UTC).

The format is according to [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html), expressed in a combined date, time and time zone format. A more readable version of the format is yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSS[-HH:MM]. Examples are "2016-05-24T08:38:08.699-04:00", "2016-05-24T08:38:08.699Z" (where Z indicates Zulu time zone, same as UTC).

TransactionScenario.title: TransactionScenario
TransactionScenario.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- DEPOSIT - Used for performing a Cash-In (deposit) transaction. In a normal scenario, electronic funds are transferred from a Business account to a Consumer account, and physical cash is given from the Consumer to the Business User.
- WITHDRAWAL - Used for performing a Cash-Out (withdrawal) transaction. In a normal scenario, electronic funds are transferred from a Consumers account to a Business account, and physical cash is given from the Business User to the Consumer.
- TRANSFER - Used for performing a P2P (Peer to Peer, or Consumer to Consumer) transaction.
- PAYMENT - Usually used for performing a transaction from a Consumer to a Merchant or Organization, but could also be for a B2B (Business to Business) payment. The transaction could be online for a purchase in an Internet store, in a physical store where both the Consumer and Business User are present, a bill payment, a donation, and so on.
- REFUND - Used for performing a refund of transaction.

TransactionInitiator.title: TransactionInitiator
TransactionInitiator.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- PAYER - Sender of funds is initiating the transaction. The account to send from is either owned by the Payer or is connected to the Payer in some way.
- PAYEE - Recipient of the funds is initiating the transaction by sending a transaction request. The Payer must approve the transaction, either automatically by a pre-generated OTP or by pre-approval of the Payee, or by manually approving in his or her own Device.

TransactionInitiatorType.title: TransactionInitiatorType
TransactionInitiatorType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- CONSUMER - Consumer is the initiator of the transaction.
- AGENT - Agent is the initiator of the transaction.
- BUSINESS - Business is the initiator of the transaction.
- DEVICE - Device is the initiator of the transaction.

partyIdInfo.description: Data model for the complex type PartyIdInfo. An ExtensionList element has been added to this reqeust in version v1.1

partyIdType.title: PartyIdType
partyIdType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- MSISDN - An MSISDN (Mobile Station International Subscriber Directory Number, that is, the phone number) is used as reference to a participant. The MSISDN identifier should be in international format according to the [ITU-T E.164 standard](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). Optionally, the MSISDN may be prefixed by a single plus sign, indicating the international prefix.
- EMAIL - An email is used as reference to a participant. The format of the email should be according to the informational [RFC 3696](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3696).
- PERSONAL_ID - A personal identifier is used as reference to a participant. Examples of personal identification are passport number, birth certificate number, and national registration number. The identifier number is added in the PartyIdentifier element. The personal identifier type is added in the PartySubIdOrType element.
- BUSINESS - A specific Business (for example, an organization or a company) is used as reference to a participant. The BUSINESS identifier can be in any format. To make a transaction connected to a specific username or bill number in a Business, the PartySubIdOrType element should be used.
- DEVICE - A specific device (for example, a POS or ATM) ID connected to a specific business or organization is used as reference to a Party. For referencing a specific device under a specific business or organization, use the PartySubIdOrType element.
- ACCOUNT_ID - A bank account number or FSP account ID should be used as reference to a participant. The ACCOUNT_ID identifier can be in any format, as formats can greatly differ depending on country and FSP.
- IBAN - A bank account number or FSP account ID is used as reference to a participant. The IBAN identifier can consist of up to 34 alphanumeric characters and should be entered without whitespace.
- ALIAS An alias is used as reference to a participant. The alias should be created in the FSP as an alternative reference to an account owner. Another example of an alias is a username in the FSP system. The ALIAS identifier can be in any format. It is also possible to use the PartySubIdOrType element for identifying an account under an Alias defined by the PartyIdentifier.

- MSISDN - An MSISDN (Mobile Station International Subscriber Directory Number, that is, the phone number) is used as reference to a participant. The MSISDN identifier should be in international format according to the [ITU-T E.164 standard](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). Optionally, the MSISDN may be prefixed by a single plus sign, indicating the international prefix.
- EMAIL - An email is used as reference to a participant. The format of the email should be according to the informational [RFC 3696](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3696).
- PERSONAL_ID - A personal identifier is used as reference to a participant. Examples of personal identification are passport number, birth certificate number, and national registration number. The identifier number is added in the PartyIdentifier element. The personal identifier type is added in the PartySubIdOrType element.
- BUSINESS - A specific Business (for example, an organization or a company) is used as reference to a participant. The BUSINESS identifier can be in any format. To make a transaction connected to a specific username or bill number in a Business, the PartySubIdOrType element should be used.
- DEVICE - A specific device (for example, a POS or ATM) ID connected to a specific business or organization is used as reference to a Party. For referencing a specific device under a specific business or organization, use the PartySubIdOrType element.
- ACCOUNT_ID - A bank account number or FSP account ID should be used as reference to a participant. The ACCOUNT_ID identifier can be in any format, as formats can greatly differ depending on country and FSP.
- IBAN - A bank account number or FSP account ID is used as reference to a participant. The IBAN identifier can consist of up to 34 alphanumeric characters and should be entered without whitespace.
- ALIAS An alias is used as reference to a participant. The alias should be created in the FSP as an alternative reference to an account owner. Another example of an alias is a username in the FSP system. The ALIAS identifier can be in any format. It is also possible to use the PartySubIdOrType element for identifying an account under an Alias defined by the PartyIdentifier.

items.title: Currency
items.description: The currency codes defined in [ISO 4217](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html) as three-letter alphabetic codes are used as the standard naming representation for currencies.

amountType.title: AmountType
amountType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration AmountType.
- SEND - Amount the Payer would like to send, that is, the amount that should be withdrawn from the Payer account including any fees.
- RECEIVE - Amount the Payer would like the Payee to receive, that is, the amount that should be sent to the receiver exclusive of any fees.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The API data type Amount is a JSON String in a canonical format that is restricted by a regular expression for interoperability reasons. This pattern does not allow any trailing zeroes at all, but allows an amount without a minor currency unit. It also only allows four digits in the minor currency unit; a negative value is not allowed. Using more than 18 digits in the major currency unit is not allowed.

transactionType.title: TransactionType
transactionType.description: Data model for the complex type TransactionType.

scenario.title: TransactionScenario
scenario.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- DEPOSIT - Used for performing a Cash-In (deposit) transaction. In a normal scenario, electronic funds are transferred from a Business account to a Consumer account, and physical cash is given from the Consumer to the Business User.
- WITHDRAWAL - Used for performing a Cash-Out (withdrawal) transaction. In a normal scenario, electronic funds are transferred from a Consumers account to a Business account, and physical cash is given from the Business User to the Consumer.
- TRANSFER - Used for performing a P2P (Peer to Peer, or Consumer to Consumer) transaction.
- PAYMENT - Usually used for performing a transaction from a Consumer to a Merchant or Organization, but could also be for a B2B (Business to Business) payment. The transaction could be online for a purchase in an Internet store, in a physical store where both the Consumer and Business User are present, a bill payment, a donation, and so on.
- REFUND - Used for performing a refund of transaction.

subScenario.title: TransactionSubScenario
subScenario.description: Possible sub-scenario, defined locally within the scheme (UndefinedEnum Type).

initiator.title: TransactionInitiator
initiator.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- PAYER - Sender of funds is initiating the transaction. The account to send from is either owned by the Payer or is connected to the Payer in some way.
- PAYEE - Recipient of the funds is initiating the transaction by sending a transaction request. The Payer must approve the transaction, either automatically by a pre-generated OTP or by pre-approval of the Payee, or by manually approving in his or her own Device.

initiatorType.title: TransactionInitiatorType
initiatorType.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- CONSUMER - Consumer is the initiator of the transaction.
- AGENT - Agent is the initiator of the transaction.
- BUSINESS - Business is the initiator of the transaction.
- DEVICE - Device is the initiator of the transaction.

allOf.title: CurrencyConverter
allOf.description: Below are the allowed values for the enumeration CurrencyConverter. - PAYER - Currency conversion should be performed by the payer. - PAYEE - Currency conversion should be performed by the payee.

An optional field which will allow the payer DFSP to specify which DFSP it wants to undertake currency conversion. This is useful incase of if the sender wants the recipient to receive a specified amount of the target currency, but the payer DFSP does not want to undertake the currency conversion. In this case, the amount of the transfer would be expressed in the target currency and the amountType would be set to RECEIVE.

allOf.title: AmountType
allOf.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration AmountType.
- SEND - Amount the Payer would like to send, that is, the amount that should be withdrawn from the Payer account including any fees.
- RECEIVE - Amount the Payer would like the Payee to receive, that is, the amount that should be sent to the receiver exclusive of any fees.

This is the AmountType for the base transaction - If SEND - then any charges levied by the FXP as part of the transaction will be deducted by the FXP from the amount shown for the target party in the conversion. If RECEIVE - then any charges levied by the FXP as part of the transaction will be added by the FXP to the amount shown for the source party in the conversion.

allOf.description: Identifier that correlates all messages of the same sequence. The supported identifiers formats are for lowercase [UUID](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc9562) and uppercase [ULID](https://github.com/ulid/spec)
The transaction ID of the transfer on whose success this currency conversion depends.

allOf.title: FspId
allOf.description: FSP identifier.
The id of the participant who is requesting a currency conversion.

allOf.title: FspId
allOf.description: FSP identifier.
The ID of the FXP performing the conversion.

allOf.title: AmountType
allOf.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration AmountType.
- SEND - Amount the Payer would like to send, that is, the amount that should be withdrawn from the Payer account including any fees.
- RECEIVE - Amount the Payer would like the Payee to receive, that is, the amount that should be sent to the receiver exclusive of any fees.

This is the AmountType for the base transaction - If SEND - then any charges levied by the FXP as part of the transaction will be deducted by the FXP from the amount shown for the target party in the conversion. If RECEIVE - then any charges levied by the FXP as part of the transaction will be added by the FXP to the amount shown for the source party in the conversion.

allOf.title: FxMoney
allOf.description: Data model for the complex type FxMoney; This is based on the type Money but allows the amount to be optional to support FX quotations.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency codes defined in [ISO 4217](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html) as three-letter alphabetic codes are used as the standard naming representation for currencies.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The API data type Amount is a JSON String in a canonical format that is restricted by a regular expression for interoperability reasons. This pattern does not allow any trailing zeroes at all, but allows an amount without a minor currency unit. It also only allows four digits in the minor currency unit; a negative value is not allowed. Using more than 18 digits in the major currency unit is not allowed.

allOf.description: The amount to be converted, expressed in the source currency.

The format is according to [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html), expressed in a combined date, time and time zone format. allOf.title: DateTime
allOf.description: The API data type DateTime is a JSON String in a lexical format that is restricted by a regular expression for interoperability reasons. The format is according to [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html), expressed in a combined date, time and time zone format. A more readable version of the format is yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSS[-HH:MM]. Examples are "2016-05-24T08:38:08.699-04:00", "2016-05-24T08:38:08.699Z" (where Z indicates Zulu time zone, same as UTC).
Time and date when the conversion was executed.

allOf.title: TransferState
allOf.description:
Below are the allowed values for the enumeration.
- RECEIVED - Next ledger has received the transfer.
- RESERVED - Next ledger has reserved the transfer.
- COMMITTED - Next ledger has successfully performed the transfer.
- ABORTED - Next ledger has aborted the transfer due to a rejection or failure to perform the transfer.
The current status of the conversion request.
